intro: Engelmannia nuttalliana, commonly known as the mountain mallow, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Engelmannia nuttalliana is adapted to harsh environmental conditions and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
